Notes: Marbug virus-specific slightly modified real-time RT-PCR
Title: Marburg virus infection detected in a common African bat
Sampling_Notes: 100mg tissue homogenized
General_Notes: First report of Marburg virus in naturally infected non-primates; unique virus lineage distinct from previously characterized strains
Full_Reference: Towner, Jonathan S., Xavier Pourrut, C_sar G. Albari_o, Chimne Nze Nkogue, Brian H. Bird, Gilda Grard, Thomas G. Ksiazek, Jean-Paul Gonzalez, Stuart T. Nichol, and Eric M. Leroy. "Marburg virus infection detected in a common African bat."_PLoS One_2, no. 8 (2007): e764.

Title: Bats worldwide carry hepatitis E virus-related viruses that form a putative novel genus within the family Hepeviridae.

General_Notes: total bats not explicitly stated; assumed to be total sample #; individual bat #s not stated, did not assume different samples came from different bats; total viruses found not explicitly stated - assumed to be total novel viruses described
Full_Reference: Drexler, Jan Felix, Annika Seelen, Victor Max Corman, Adriana Fumie Tateno, Veronika Cottontail, Rodrigo Melim Zerbinati, Florian Gloza-Rausch et al. Notes: This species has often used the name_Myotis ricketti_(Thomas, 1894), but_pilosus_has priority (Smith and Xie 2008). The erroneous reporting of the type locality as being in Uruguay, by Peters, led to the dual naming (Smith and Xie 2008).

Title: Identification of Mammalian orthoreovirus type 3 in Italian bats.

Title: Bats are a major natural reservoir for hepaciviruses and pegiviruses.

Title: Molecular detection of a novel paramyxovirus in fruit bats from Indonesia.

Notes: semi-nested PCR with Pan-PyV
Title: Discovery of diverse polyomaviruses in bats and the evolutionary history of the Polyomaviridae.
Sampling_Notes: mist and hand nets; euthanized; specimens included blood, organs, rectal, oral swabs
General_Notes: 12 PyV lineages sequenced; 7 full (novel), 5 not full (probably also novel species)
Full_Reference: Tao, Ying, Mang Shi, Christina Conrardy, Ivan V. Kuzmin, Sergio Recuenco, Bernard Agwanda, Danilo A. Alvarez et al. "Discovery of diverse polyomaviruses in bats and the evolutionary history of the Polyomaviridae."Journal of General Virology_94, no. Pt 4 (2013): 738-748.

General_Notes: 12 PyV lineages sequenced; 7 full (novel), 5 not full (probably also novel species)

Title: Discovery and genomic characterization of a novel bat sapovirus with unusual genomic features and phylogenetic position.
Sampling_Notes: unclear whether killed; anal swabs collected
Full_Reference: Tse, Herman, Wan-Mui Chan, Kenneth SM Li, Susanna KP Lau, Patrick CY Woo, and Kwok-Yung Yuen. "Discovery and Genomic Characterization of a Novel Bat Sapovirus with Unusual Genomic Features and Phylogenetic Position."_PloS one_7, no. 4 (2012): e34987.

Notes: This species has often used the name_Myotis ricketti_(Thomas, 1894), but_pilosus_has priority (Smith and Xie 2008). The erroneous reporting of the type locality as being in Uruguay, by Peters, led to the dual naming (Smith and Xie 2008).

Notes: Respiro/Morbilli/Henipavirus RT-PCR; This species has often used the name_Myotis ricketti_(Thomas, 1894), but_pilosus_has priority (Smith and Xie 2008). The erroneous reporting of the type locality as being in Uruguay, by Peters, led to the dual naming (Smith and Xie 2008).
Title: Virome analysis for identification of novel mammalian viruses in bat species from Chinese provinces.
Sampling_Notes: pharyngeal and anal swabs collected; pooled by species; assumed not killed
General_Notes: 11 bat families screened for with NGS; most viruses were phages, insect viruses, fungal viruses, and plant viruses; mammalian viruses ~9%
Full_Reference: Wu, Zhiqiang, Xianwen Ren, Li Yang, Yongfeng Hu, Jian Yang, Guimei He, Junpeng Zhang et al. "Virome analysis for identification of novel mammalian viruses in bat species from Chinese provinces."_Journal of Virology_86, no. 20 (2012): 10999-11012.

Title: Antibodies to nipah or nipah-like viruses in bats, China.
Sampling_Notes: trapped in natural habitat in China; serum, pharyngeal, fecal swabs collected; blood taken from brachial artery/vein or heart; "most animals survived_and were released_those which did not survive were anatomised"; used Li et al. 2005 methods
General_Notes: total bats killed not explicitly stated; n=692 serum samples but appendix only has n=687 bats/samples
Full_Reference: Li, Yan, Jianmin Wang, Andrew C. Hickey, Yunzhi Zhang, Yuchun Li, Yi Wu, Huajun Zhang et al. "Antibodies to Nipah or Nipah-like viruses in bats, China."Emerging infectious diseases_14, no. 12 (2008): 1974.

Notes: This species has often used the name_Myotis ricketti_(Thomas, 1894), but_pilosus_has priority (Smith and Xie 2008). The erroneous reporting of the type locality as being in Uruguay, by Peters, led to the dual naming (Smith and Xie 2008).
